metadata.Title: CVE-2013-4650 on Ubuntu 14.04 ESM (trusty) - medium.
metadata.Description:
MongoDB 2.4.x before 2.4.5 and 2.5.x before 2.5.1 allows remote authenticated users to obtain internal system privileges by leveraging a username of __system in an arbitrary database.

Update Instructions:

Run `sudo pro fix CVE-2013-4650` to fix the vulnerability. The problem can be corrected
by updating your system to the following package versions:

mongodb - 1:2.4.9-1ubuntu2
mongodb-clients - 1:2.4.9-1ubuntu2
mongodb-server - 1:2.4.9-1ubuntu2
No subscription required

criterions.comment: mongodb package in trusty, is related to the CVE in some way and has been fixed (note: '1:2.4.9-1ubuntu2').
